speaker: doctor
text: Let me perform a physical examination. On general appearance, the patient appears fatigued and mildly dyspneic at rest, but is alert and oriented.

speaker: doctor
text: Skin examination shows cool and slightly mottled extremities with decreased capillary refill.

speaker: doctor
text: Eye exam reveals pupils are equal and reactive to light, extraocular movements intact. Conjunctiva are pale.

speaker: doctor
text: ENT exam shows ears are clear, throat reveals mild erythema without exudates.

speaker: doctor
text: Mouth shows dry mucous membranes but otherwise normal oral mucosa with adequate dentition.

speaker: doctor
text: Neck exam reveals mild jugular venous distension at 30 degrees, supple with full range of motion, no lymphadenopathy.

speaker: doctor
text: On pulmonary examination, there are bilateral crackles at the bases with decreased breath sounds in the right lower lobe. Some expiratory wheezing noted.

speaker: doctor
text: Cardiovascular exam shows tachycardia with regular rhythm, S1 and S2 present, a grade 2 out of 6 systolic murmur heard best at the apex.

speaker: doctor
text: Extremities show trace bilateral pedal edema and mild clubbing of the fingernails. No cyanosis.

speaker: doctor
text: Additionally, the patient is using accessory muscles for breathing and has a productive cough.
